title: If I own the score to a piece of music that is not in the public domain, do I have the right to record and perform that music without getting into legal trouble? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Owning a piece of paper with the musical score does not grant you any rights to the score, except ownership of that piece of paper. Performing or recording (and then performing) that score publicly will require copyright permissions to be obtained, usually from a copyright agency. Performing at a private event is ok without permission.
You certainly have the right to perform it. Recording is a little more confusing, but I think unless you're doing a professional recording for sale then I doubt anything would happen.
